subject: Re: [junit] Re: test with private methd
msgSnippet: ... I argue strongly for remove. Once eliminated from active use, the test method will rapidly become obsolete. Any help one might have gotten from it becomes
messageBody:
--- Andrew Clarke <andrew.clarke@...> wrote:
>That means we have to remove/comment out the tests that explicitly
> accessed it: we know the private method is still working properly

I argue strongly for remove. Once eliminated from active use, the test
method will rapidly become obsolete. Any help one might have gotten
from it becomes a hinderance as the commented-out code is no longer
correct. Should I happen to be wrong about deleting a particular
method, I always have my source control system (CVS) to go back and get
the old test.

Regards,

Rob
